returns._0: The address of the deployment. May be `address(0)` if the deployment does not         exist.
Whether the deployment exists or not.

params._addr: The mock address of the deployment.

get(string).notice: Returns a deployment that is suitable to be used to interact with contracts.

getAddress(string).notice: Returns the address of a deployment. Also handles the predeploys.

has(string).notice: Returns whether or not a particular deployment exists.

mustGetAddress(string).notice: Returns the address of a deployment and reverts if the deployment         does not exist.

newDeployments().notice: Returns all of the deployments done in the current context.

save(string,address).notice: Appends a deployment to disk as a JSON deploy artifact.

get(string).notice: Returns a deployment that is suitable to be used to interact with contracts.

getAddress(string).notice: Returns the address of a deployment. Also handles the predeploys.

has(string).notice: Returns whether or not a particular deployment exists.

mustGetAddress(string).notice: Returns the address of a deployment and reverts if the deployment         does not exist.

newDeployments().notice: Returns all of the deployments done in the current context.

save(string,address).notice: Appends a deployment to disk as a JSON deploy artifact.

DeploymentDoesNotExist(string).notice: Error for when attempting to fetch a deployment and it does not exist

InvalidDeployment(string).notice: Error for when trying to save an invalid deployment

userdoc.notice: Useful for accessing deployment artifacts from within scripts.

returns._0: The address of the deployment. May be `address(0)` if the deployment does not         exist.
Whether the deployment exists or not.

params._addr: The mock address of the deployment.

documentation.text:
@notice Represents a deployment. Is serialized to JSON as a key/value
         pair. Can be accessed from within scripts.
@notice Foundry cheatcode VM.
@notice Error for when attempting to fetch a deployment and it does not exist
@notice Error for when trying to save an invalid deployment
@notice The set of deployments that have been done during execution.
@notice The same as `_namedDeployments` but as an array.
@notice Path to the directory containing the hh deploy style artifacts
@notice The path to the deployment artifact that is being written to.
@notice The namespace for the deployment. Can be set with the env var DEPLOYMENT_CONTEXT.

function (string memory) view external returns (string memory)
function (string memory,string memory) view external returns (string memory)

documentation.text: @notice Setup function. The arguments here

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (string memory[] memory) external returns (bytes memory)
function (string memory,string memory) pure external returns (string memory[] memory)

documentation.text:
@notice Populates the addresses to be used in a script based on a JSON file.
         The format of the JSON file is the same that it output by this script
         as well as the JSON files that contain addresses in the `superchain-ops`
         repo. The JSON key is the name of the contract and the value is an address.

typeDescriptions.typeString: struct Deployment storage ref[] storage ref

documentation.text: @notice Returns all of the deployments done in the current context.
